meanings.definition: To equip or outfit with new tools or machinery.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic will retool the workshop with modern equipment.
meanings.sent2: The factory decided to retool their assembly line for increased efficiency.
meanings.sent3: I guess I'll have to retool my toolbox if I want to fix this.
meanings.sent4: She had to retool her kitchen gadgets to prepare for the baking competition.
meanings.sent5: The carpenter's decision to retool his workshop transformed his productivity.

meanings.definition: To adapt or adjust for a new purpose or use.
meanings.sent1: The company will retool their marketing strategy to target a younger audience.
meanings.sent2: After the feedback, the team decided to retool their presentation for better clarity.
meanings.sent3: I had to retool my speech for the kids to understand the complex topic.
meanings.sent4: She had to retool her resume to apply for the new position.
meanings.sent5: The coach's decision to retool the game plan led to a surprising victory.
